title: Led by Trump and Johnson, Disrupters Rise Globally
summary: President Trump is the most prominent leader to take a wrecking ball to a prevailing political system. He wasn't the first, nor will he be the last.. We are living in an age of technological disruption, so it figures that the most important trend in international politics is the rise of disrupters around the globe.

title: Justice Department Fills Fraud Section Post Long in Limbo
summary: Robert Zink will permanently fill a position left in limbo after its former occupant was tapped by the special counsel's office. The U.S. Justice Department has appointed Robert Zink as chief of the agency's criminal fraud section.

title: Cloud Computing Is Here. Cloud Recycling Is Next.
summary: The short lifespan of data-center equipment means older servers are already being replaced, creating a new market for recycling firms. SYDNEY-The world's $300 billion scrap-metal market is looking beyond junked cars and copy machines to a new prize: the cloud.

title: Federal Borrowing Soars as Deficit Fear Fades
summary: The Treasury expects to sell over $1 trillion in debt this year; issue has little traction in 2020 race. WASHINGTON-Borrowing by the federal government is set to top $1 trillion for the second year in a row as higher spending outpaces revenue growth and concern about budget deficits wanes in Washington and on Wall Street.

title: The Confusing Federal Reserve
summary: The second-quarter GDP report did not make the case for easing.. Last December equity markets were tanking, credit markets were seizing up, and inflation expectations were falling. The Federal Reserve nonetheless raised interest rates and signaled that the shrinkage of its balance sheet was on "autopilot." Further market turmoil soon caused the central bankers to concede their error.

title: Smearing Mitch McConnell
summary: Democrats and the media distort his record on Russia.. Mitch McConnell, the most phlegmatic man in American politics, rarely gets riled up. But on Monday the Senate Majority Leader let it rip in defense of his reputation, and we're glad he did.

title: Big Pharma vs. Big Pharma
summary: Pfizer's deal with Mylan may make both more competitive.. Pfizer on Monday announced a deal to combine its off-patent drugs with Mylan, one of the world's largest generic manufacturers. This Big Pharma cocktail could help both manufacturers cope with increased competition, but maybe it should come with a black box warning for investors: High risk of political intervention.

title: Alleged 9/11 Mastermind Open to Helping Victims' Lawsuit if U.S. Drops Death Penalty
summary: Guantanamo detainee Khalid Sheikh Mohammed's pending trial is still in flux. WASHINGTON-Alleged Sept. 11 mastermind Khalid Sheikh Mohammed has opened the door to helping victims of the terrorist attacks in their lawsuit against Saudi Arabia if the U.S. government spares him the death penalty at a Guantanamo Bay military commission, according to court documents.

title: New York City Is Hunting for School Space
summary: Officials say it is increasingly hard to find school sites citywide, especially in rapidly developing areas. New York City officials are having such a hard time finding sites for new public schools that for the first time in decades, they say they will soon advertise to recruit potential property sellers.

title: A Fed Reversal Will Store Up Trouble
summary: The central bank may cut interest rates when asset prices are high and unemployment low. Why?. Will the world's currencies face a reckoning in 2019? This year gold has risen 10% against the U.S. dollar. Alternative currencies like bitcoin have risen about 160% against the dollar. All other major currencies have also fallen by similar magnitudes against both gold and bitcoin-troubling signs. The larger story is that an unnecessary return to fiscal and monetary stimulus, signaled over the past few weeks by the Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank, may produce a crisis of confidence in fiat currencies, including the U.S. dollar.

title: California Wants to Teach Your Kids That Capitalism Is Racist
summary: A new model curriculum for 'ethnic studies' is a handbook for classroom propagandizing.. California's Education Department has issued an "Ethnic Studies Model Curriculum" and is soliciting public comments on it until Aug. 15. The legislatively mandated guide is a resource for teachers who want to instruct their students in the field of "ethnic studies," and was written by an advisory board of teachers, academics and bureaucrats. It's as bad as you imagine.

title: 'The College Dropout Scandal' Review: A Matter of Degree
summary: Some schools have made student success their top priority and are ﬁnding effective, hands-on ways to increase graduation rates.. How much is a college degree worth? There are many ways to answer that question-the additional lifetime earnings, the mind-opening courses, the contacts with fellow alumni. But here's a harder question: How much is some college attendance worth? The answer, unfortunately, is almost nothing. As David Kirp notes in "The College Dropout Scandal," "the contention that college is the engine of social mobility is false advertising for the 34 million Americans over twenty-five . . . who have some college credits but dropped out before receiving a diploma." What is more, many such students "are worse off economically than if they hadn't started college," thanks to the money they've spent on tuition, not to mention the opportunity cost of the wages they've foregone.

title: Environmental Extremists Favor Mosquitoes Over Mankind
summary: Genetically altered insects could save millions from malaria but are anathema to 'agroecologists.'. A child under 5 dies from malaria about every two minutes world-wide. Yet radical environmentalists are mobilizing against an important measure to stop mosquitoes from spreading the disease.

title: Rig Owners Forecast Further Drilling Decline
summary: Rise in oil prices hasn't been enough to bring sector consistent profitability or interest from investors. Drilling rig owners and others who lease equipment to U.S. energy producers forecast a slowdown in activity during the second half of the year as natural-gas prices plumb lows and exploration-and-production companies exhaust their budgets.

title: The Battle of the Microwave
summary: At 13, my brother beat my father in an epic domestic conflict.. I was born too late to witness many of history's greatest battles of wits: David vs. Goliath, Hannibal vs. Scipio Africanus, Patton vs. Rommel. But I did have the good fortune to observe firsthand one epic struggle, the Battle of the Microwave, pitting the Odyssean wiliness of two men-my father and my younger brother, Jack-against each other.

title: Mayor Pete Has a Race Problem
summary: Buttigieg has even less black support than the president he calls a racist.. "My generation saw this country elect its first black president and then turn around and elect a racist to the White House-and we ought to call that what it is." So thundered Pete Buttigieg in an address Friday to the National Urban League.

title: Notable & Quotable: Blame Taxes for Baltimore's Rot
summary: 'Those of us who live in Baltimore are often asked whether our city really is the hellhole it is portrayed to be on TV.'. From "Blame Taxes for Baltimore's Rot" by Steve H. Hanke and Stephen J.K. Walters in the Journal, July 5, 2008:

title: Why Russia and China Are Joining Forces
summary: The past few years have witnessed a marked increase in American power.. Russian and Chinese military aircraft probed South Korean and Japanese air defenses last week, leading the South Koreans to fire more than 300 warning shots before the intruders departed.

title: Beyond Meat On Track to Deliver Profit This Year
summary: Shares drop after hours on plans to issue more stock. Beyond Meat Inc. said sales of its plant-based burgers and sausages continued to surge, though shares dropped after hours on plans to issue more stock.

title: Senate Fails to Block Arms Sales to Saudi Arabia, U.A.E.
summary: Chamber falls short in attempt to override president's veto of legislation preventing the sales. WASHINGTON-A congressional effort to block certain arms sales to Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates fell short on Monday after the Senate failed to override President Trump's veto of the measures.

title: Hospitals May Be Forced to Disclose Discount Rates Negotiated With Insurers
summary: Trump administration rule would compel hospitals to reveal prices for services in effort to boost transparency, competition. Hospitals would have to disclose the discounted prices they negotiate with insurance companies under a Trump administration rule that could upend the $1 trillion hospital industry by revealing rates long guarded as trade secrets.

title: U.S. Soccer Says Women's Team Has Been Paid More Than Men's Team
summary: Letter from U.S. Soccer president Carlos Cordeiro comes ahead of mediation in the women's teams pay-equity lawsuit. The U.S. Soccer Federation released a letter from its president Monday saying it has paid the U.S. Women's National Team more than the men's team in recent years, a move that comes ahead of mediation in the women's team's pay-equity lawsuit against its employer.

title: Remixes Propel Lil Nas X's 'Old Town Road' to Billboard Chart Record
summary: Single has clinched top song ranking for 17 weeks, besting earlier Mariah Carey, Luis Fonsi milestones. Country-rap hit "Old Town Road" became the longest-running No. 1 song in Billboard chart history on Monday.

title: Refinancing Boom Boosts Mortgage Lending
summary: Lenders made $565 billion of mortgage loans in second quarter, most in more than two years. The mortgage market had one of its most significant quarters since the financial crisis as falling rates prompted a flurry of refinancing and an uptick in purchases.

title: Mylan Deal Furthers Pfizer CEO's Bet on Patent-Protected Drugs
summary: Merging its off-patent drugs business with Mylan is part of new Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla's plan for bolstering sales growth. title: Bank of America, First Data End Payments Partnership
summary: Bank expects to record an impairment charge in the third quarter between $1.7 billion and $2.1 billion. Bank of America Corp. is disbanding its payment-processing joint venture with First Data, giving the bank more control of its business that focuses on moving money for merchants.

title: Strong Earnings Allay Fears Over Trade and Growth-for Now
summary: Companies like Alphabet and Twitter are beating expectations, but investors are pessimistic about the rest of the year. Corporate profits are proving to be more resilient than expected in the second quarter, nudging the stock market higher this month and distracting from anxieties about trade and economic growth.

title: London Stock Exchange's Big Bet Is Profitable but Risky
summary: For now, investors are more focused on the profit potential of the LSE's $15 billion acquisition of Refinitiv than on the financial and operational hurdles. Investors rarely endorse deals as wholeheartedly as they did London Stock Exchange Group 's roughly $15 billion proposed acquisition of data provider Refinitiv on Monday morning. The euphoria needs to be balanced by recognition that this would mark a big step up the risk curve.

title: Mylan CFO Set to Leave as Part of Pfizer Deal
summary: Mergers and acquisitions often result in executive duplications, forcing some executives to depart. Mergers and acquisitions create winners and losers among finance chiefs, as Pfizer Inc.'s deal to merge one of its businesses with Mylan NV indicates.

title: SoftBank's New Fund Stands to Shake Up Enterprise Tech
summary: 'There will be massive ripple effects,' says venture-capital executive Ed Sim, founder of much smaller Boldstart Ventures. SoftBank Group Corp.'s $108 billion technology fund will have a big impact on the venture-backed startups helping to develop next-generation enterprise technology, investors say.

title: A Public Option Is No Winner for Democrats
summary: While it's true that most Americans don't want "a radical change tearing up existing plans," a "public option" health care system would ultimately do just that,. Tsung-Mei Cheng ("Stick to the Public Option, Democrats," op-ed, July 15) seems to believe the examples of Medicaid, Medicare and the VA health-care system can be used to promote expanding government-managed health insurance.

title: Smaller Money Managers Drowning in Rules
summary: Further regulating small advisers, who are already swamped by regulatory requirements, will serve only to put more good people out of business.. "Small Money Managers Lack Backstop" (Banking & Finance, July 24) implies that increased regulatory burdens will prevent outright thieves from preying on investors. However, the article is about criminals, not actual investment advisers. As an independent investment adviser, I can tell you there are mountains of regulation and oversight already in place, but these hurdles won't stop the occasional evildoer from taking advantage of trusting people.

title: Dealing With the High Price of Some Insulin
summary: I have serious diabetes mellitus and have managed it with Lilly insulin for a decade for under $100 a month. Tens of thousands do likewise.. Regarding William Galston's "The Drug-Price Problem Won't Heal Itself" (Politics & Ideas, July 24): I note that he and other writers who lament the cost of insulin seem not to know that Eli Lilly makes three types of insulin, which in most states you can buy over-the-counter at Walmart for $24 per 1,000-unit bottle. One hundred syringes cost $12. I have serious diabetes mellitus and have managed it with Lilly insulin for a decade for under $100 a month. Tens of thousands do likewise. Because it's over-the-counter, it frees diabetes sufferers from the soft extortion of doctors who force patients to appear for expensive, unneeded checkups to renew prescriptions.

title: Blame Obama, not Kerry For the Terrible Iran Deal
summary: You imply that the "decider," as President George W. Bush described himself, is Mr. Kerry, not President Obama.. Regarding your editorial "Boris Johnson's Iran Test" (July 22): Your discussion of the role of former Secretary of State John Kerry for being "outmaneuvered" by his Iranian counterpart and the reference to ballistic missiles in the July 2015 agreement require elaboration.

title: Melinda Katz Is Certified Winner of Queens District Attorney Primary
summary: Declaration follows a lengthy recount in the Democratic race; Tiffany Cabán plans to challenge the results in court. summary: The Mostly Mozart Festival brought fresh zest to the classical music world in an evening of three short concerts, including a performance by Finnish violinist Pekka Kuusisto of Vivaldi's 'Four Seasons' with improvisation..

summary: Trump plans to nominate GOP Rep. John Ratcliffe of Texas, who stridently questioned Robert Mueller last week, for the position. WASHINGTON-President Trump said Sunday that Director of National Intelligence Dan Coats, who has tangled with the president over how to deal with the threat posed by Russia, is leaving his post.

title: Trump Keeps Up His Criticism of Rep. Elijah Cummings
summary: President accuses House Oversight panel's head of failing to address 'crime & conditions in Baltimore'. President Trump targeted the head of the House Oversight committee for further criticism on Sunday, after a day earlier accusing Rep. Elijah Cummings of doing a "very poor job for his district and the City of Baltimore" and describing the district as a "disgusting, rat and rodent infested mess."

title: Former Fed Chief Yellen Endorses Quarter-Point Rate Cut This Week
summary: While the U.S. economy is doing well, inflation is 'too low' and global growth is weakening, she says. Former Federal Reserve Chairwoman Janet Yellen said she endorses a quarter-percentage-point cut in the central bank's benchmark interest rate this week because of worries over global growth and low inflation.

title: Store Brands Cut Into Big Food
summary: Kraft, Conagra take a sales hit as retailers stock more of their own private-label products. Store-branded products from cheese to canned tomatoes are eating away at sales for big food companies.

title: Hong Kong Clashes Flare, Sparking Fears for Territory's Future
summary: Anger at the police and Beijing's erosion of the city's autonomy once again drew thousands of people into the streets. HONG KONG-Police and demonstrators clashed in Hong Kong this weekend in some of the fiercest confrontations to rock the semiautonomous Chinese city, fueling apprehension that a summer of protests against the encroachment of Beijing is veering into dangerous new territory.

title: Next in Line to Govern Troubled Puerto Rico Doesn't Want the Job
summary: Secretary of Justice Wanda Vázquez's statement creates new uncertainty for U.S. territory in turmoil. The leadership of Puerto Rico was thrown into further uncertainty as the official slated to replace the U.S. territory's governor said she didn't want the job.
